title: How to describe a deserted place (descriptive writing) - Quora

response.answer_text: Deserted Will mean that the place was formerly inhabited. Thus certain elements of lack of occupation will feature. This are:- Geographical look- if there were farms,is the place now bushy?Architecture- describe ruins, how rusty,cobwebs etc.Kind of colonization that thrived around- what's lacking from your point of view. eg tradition, culture etc.In short, you'll the presence but describe the absence.

I always think that deserted places are all about atmosphete and ‘feelings'. Maybe left over memories, either happy or sad. To evoke those feelings try to imagine how it might have been before it was deserted. Who, or what, may have lived or been there. Where is it? Town or country? What they may have experienced. What they felt. Why they left. It is a huge space for experiences. Good luck!
